description: <p>Registered Nurse - Nights<br />Shifts 7.45 pm - 7.15 am<br />Full time & part time hours available<br />£24755 - £27121 basic per annum<br /><br />Pay Enhancements:<br />8.00 pm to 6.00 am (nights) 30%<br />Friday midnight to Sunday midnight (weekends) 45%<br />Public Holidays 24 hours midnight to midnight 60%<br /><br />***£2652 recruitment and retention premium pro rata***<br /><br />We have an exciting opportunity for Registered Nurse to join our professional and dedicated team at The Chantry Neurological Care Centre in Ipswich, Suffolk.<br /><br />The Chantry has been providing specialist neurological care for over 20 years and has built a strong reputation for quality, personalised and innovative care and rehabilitation through its range of residential and community based services.<br /><br />Our service provides 26 residential beds where there are exciting opportunities for growth and development across complex disability, high dependency care, slow stream rehab and level 2 rehabilitation. You would also be working closely within the in-house multidisciplinary team of physiotherapist and OTs to support goal setting and best outcomes for all clients<br /><br />Sue Ryder Benefits:<br />• Continuation of NHS pension<br />• Option to buy holiday up to 5 days<br />• 25 days holiday rising to 30 with service plus bank holidays<br />• Private pension matched at 5%<br />• Enhanced Maternity Benefits<br />• Cash referral bonus scheme for certain roles<br />• 24 hour employee assistance line for free advice on work, family and personal life<br />• PeoplePerks - discounts with hundreds of retailers and services that can amount to an average annual saving of GBP 350<br />• Staff discount of 15% on new goods at the online shop<br />• Free onsite parking and good transport links<br />• Subsidised meals<br />• Staff loans and company car loans<br />• Free uniform<br />• Wellbeing centre<br />• Opportunities to progress through our development framework structure<br /><br />To be considered as a Registered Nurse, you will ideally have:<br /><br />• Post-registration experience preferably in neurological care<br />• Up to date clinical skills<br />• Passion and drive to work in neurological care and rehabilitation<br />• The ability to demonstrate a commitment to continued professional development<br />• The ability to mentor students and less experienced staff<br /><br />It takes a special sort of person to join our team so if you could see yourself as one of our Registered Nurses, please apply via the button shown.</p>
title: Registered Nurse - Nights
